message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside is known to cause cyanide toxicity, which can lead to confusion and lactic acidosis. Cough and hypoventilation are not known side effects of nitroprusside, and hyperkalemia is more commonly associated with medications such as ACE inhibitors and potassium-sparing diuretics.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside can cause cyanide toxicity due to its breakdown in the body to release nitric oxide and cyanide. Symptoms of cyanide toxicity include confusion, lactic acidosis, and coma. Cough is not a known side effect of nitroprusside, and neither is hyperkalemia or hypoventilation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside is a potent vasodilator used for hypertensive crises, but it can cause cyanide toxicity, which can lead to confusion and lactic acidosis. Cough is not a common side effect of nitroprusside, and it does not cause hyperkalemia or hypoventilation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside can cause cyanide toxicity, especially with prolonged or high-dose infusions. Confusion and lactic acidosis are common symptoms of cyanide toxicity. Cough and hyperkalemia are not common side effects of nitroprusside administration, and hypoventilation is not related to nitroprusside.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside can cause cyanide toxicity, which can lead to confusion and lactic acidosis. Cough is not a common side effect of nitroprusside, and hyperkalemia and hypoventilation are not commonly associated with its use.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside can cause cyanide toxicity, especially in patients with renal or hepatic dysfunction, which may lead to confusion and lactic acidosis. Cough is not a known side effect, hyperkalemia and hypoventilation are also not commonly associated with nitroprusside administration.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside is known to cause cyanide toxicity, which can lead to confusion and lactic acidosis. Cough and hypoventilation are not listed as potential side effects, and hyperkalemia is not directly related to nitroprusside administration.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside can cause cyanide toxicity as it metabolizes to nitric oxide and cyanide. This can cause confusion, lactic acidosis and respiratory depression. Cough is not a common side effect of nitroprusside and hyperkalemia is not associated with nitroprusside use.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside is a vasodilator and can cause a drop in blood pressure, which can be beneficial for the patient's acute chest pain, but it can also cause cyanide toxicity if it is converted to cyanide. Confusion and lactic acidosis are signs of cyanide toxicity. Cough and hyperkalemia are not listed as side effects of nitroprusside. Hypoventilation can occur with any sedative medication, but it is not specific to nitroprusside.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Nitroprusside can cause cyanide toxicity, which can lead to confusion and lactic acidosis. Cough and hypoventilation are not known side effects of nitroprusside. Hyperkalemia is not directly related to nitroprusside administration, although it may occur if renal function is impaired and therefore blood pressure control is not optimized.
